publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Right trusty and so forth, we let you to know
We are very ill us'd, by you Mortals below.
For first I have often by Chymists been told
(Tho' I know nothing on't,) tis I yṭ make Gold,
Which when you have got, you so carefully hide it,
That since I was born I hardly have spy'd it,
Then it must be allow'd when ever I shine,
I forward yẹ Grass & ripen ye Vine,
To me yẹ Good Fellows apply for relief,
Without whom they can get neither Claret, nor Beef,
Yet their Wine & their Victuals, those Curmudgeon Lubbards
Lock up from my Sight in Pantrys & Cupboards,
That I have an ill Eye they wickedly think,
And taint all their Meat & sowr their Drink.
But thirdly & lastly, it must be allow'd
I alone can inspire ye Poetical Croud;
This is gratefully own'd by each Boy in yẹ Colledge,
Whom if I inspire, 'tis not to my knowledge,
This every pretender in Rhime will admit,
Without troubling his head about Iudgment, or Wit,
Those Gentlemen use me with kindness & freedom;
And as for their works, when I please I may read 'em
They lie open on purpose, on Counters & stalls,
And yẹ Titles I view when I shine on yẹ Walls.
But a Comerade of yours, yṭ Traytor Delany!
Whom I for yṛ Sake have us'd better than any
And of my meer motion & special good grace
Intended in time to Succeed in this Place;
On Tuesday ye tenth, he seditiously came
With a certain false Traytress, one stella by Name,
To ye Deanry House; & on ye North Glass,
Where for fear of ye Cold I never can pass
Then & there, Vi et Armis, with a certain Utensil
Of value five shillings, in English a Pencil,
Did maliciously, falsely, & Trayt'rously write
While Stella aforesaid stood by with ye light.
My Sister has lately depos'd upon Oath,
That she stopp'd in her course to look on them both,
That Stella, was helping, abetting & aiding,
And still as he writ, \del·was·add·stood\ smiling & reading;
That her Eyes were as bright as my self at Noonday,
But her gracefull black locks were mingled with grey
And by yẹ Description I certainly know,
Tis yẹ same Nymph I courted some ten years ago;
Whom when I with ye best of my Talents indued
On her promise of yeilding, she acted ye Prude.
That some Verses were written with felonious intent
Direct to ye North, where I never went.
That ye Letters appear'd revers'd on ye pane
But in stella's bright Eyes were plac'd right again,
Wherein she distinctly cou'd read every line
And presently guess'd yṭ yẹ fancy was mine.
She can swear 'tis yẹ Person, yṭ oft she has seen
At Night between Cavan-street & Colledge Green.
Now you see why his Verses so seldom are shown,
The reason is plain, they are none of his own.
And observe while you live yṭ no man is shy
To discover ye Goods he comes honestly by.
If I light on a thought he will certainly steal it,
And when he has got it find ways to conceal it,
Of all ye fine things he keeps in ye Dark,
There's scarce one in ten but what has my mark;
And let them be seen by ye world if he dare,
I'll make it appear they are all stolen ware.
But as for yẹ Poem he writ on ye Sash,
I think I have now got him under my lash;
My Sister transcrib'd it last night to his Sorrow,
And yẹ Publick shall see it if I live 'till to morrow.
Thrô ye zodiack around it shall quickly be spread
In all parts of ye Globe where ye Language is read.
He knows very well I ne'er gave a refusal
When he ask'd for my aid in yẹ forms yṭ are usual
But ye Secret is this, I did lately intend,
To write a few Verses on you as my Friend,
I studied a fortnight before I cou'd find,
As I rode in my Chariot a thought to my mind,
I resolv'd ye next winter, for yt is ye time
When ye Days are at shortest to get it in Rhyme,
Till then it was lock'd in my Box at Parnassus,
When this Subtle Companion, in hopes to surpass us
Conveys out my Paper of hints by a trick,
(For I think in my conscience he deals with old Nick)
And from my old stock provided with Topicks,
He gets to a Window beyond both ye Tropicks,
There out of my Sight beyond ye North zone,
Writes down my conceits, & calls them his own,
And you like a Cully ye Bubble can swallow,
For who but Delany can write like Apollo!
High Treason by Statute! But here you object
He only stole hints, but ye Verse is Correct.
Tho' ye thought is Apollo's tis finely exprest;
So a theif steals my horse & gets him well-Drest.
Now whereas the said Criminal seems past Repentance,
We Phœbus think fit to proceed to his Sentence.
Since Delany has dar'd like Prometheus his Sire,
To climb to our Regions & there to steal Fire,
We order a Vulture in shape of ye Spleen,
To prey on his Liver & not to be seen;
And we order our Subjects of every degree,
To believe all his Verses were written by Me.
om.
om.
And lastly for Stella, Iust out of her prime;
I'm too much already revenged by Time,
In return to her Scorn I send her Diseases,
And will now be her Freind when ever she pleases,
And ye Gifts I bestow'd her, will find her a Lover
Tho' she Lives 'till she's grey as a Badger all over.
